mlflex
Class DelimitedDataProcessor

java.lang.Object
  mlflex.AbstractDataProcessor
      mlflex.DelimitedDataProcessor

public class DelimitedDataProcessor
extends AbstractDataProcessor

This class enables the user to import data directly from delimited (for example, by tabs or commas) text files. This class ignores the final column in the file (which it assumes contains the dependent variable values). The default delimiter is a tab.

Author:
Stephen Piccolo

Constructor Detail

DelimitedDataProcessor

public DelimitedDataProcessor(java.lang.String description,
                              java.lang.String relativeFilePaths)
This constructor requires the user to specify a description that will be used and a relative file path indicating where the data file is stored.

Parameters:
description - Description of the data stored in the delimited file (must be unique to this experiment)
relativeFilePaths - Relative paths (separated by commas) where the delimited files are stored (path is relative to the raw data directory)

DelimitedDataProcessor

public DelimitedDataProcessor(java.lang.String description,
                              java.lang.String relativeFilePaths,
                              java.lang.String delimiter)
This constructor requires the user to specify a description that will be used and a relative file path indicating where the data file is stored.

Parameters:
description - Description of the data stored in the delimited file (must be unique to this experiment)
relativeFilePaths - Relative paths (separated by commas) where the delimited files are stored (path is relative to the raw data directory)
delimiter - Delimiter (use "\t" for tabs or "," for commas, etc.)

DelimitedDataProcessor

public DelimitedDataProcessor(java.lang.String description,
                              java.lang.String relativeFilePaths,
                              java.lang.String delimiter,
                              java.lang.String commentChar)
This constructor requires the user to specify a description that will be used and a relative file path indicating where the data file is stored.

Parameters:
description - Description of the data stored in the delimited file (must be unique to this experiment)
relativeFilePaths - Relative paths (separated by commas) where the delimited files are stored (path is relative to the raw data directory)
delimiter - Delimiter (use "\t" for tabs or "," for commas, etc.)
commentChar - Comment character (file lines starting with this character will be ignored)

DelimitedDataProcessor

public DelimitedDataProcessor(java.lang.String description,
                              java.lang.String relativeFilePaths,
                              java.lang.String delimiter,
                              java.lang.String commentChar,
                              java.lang.String missingValueCharacter)
This constructor requires the user to specify a description that will be used and a relative file path indicating where the data file is stored.

Parameters:
description - Description of the data stored in the delimited file (must be unique to this experiment)
relativeFilePaths - Relative paths (separated by commas) where the delimited files are stored (path is relative to the raw data directory)
delimiter - Delimiter (use "\t" for tabs or "," for commas, etc.)
commentChar - Comment character (file lines starting with this character will be ignored)
missingValueCharacter - Missing value character (if this character is encountered in the file, it will be considered missing)
Method Detail

GetDescription

public java.lang.String GetDescription()
Description copied from class: AbstractDataProcessor
This method provides a description of the data provided by this processor. By default this description is the beginning of the class name.

Overrides:
GetDescription in class AbstractDataProcessor
Returns:
Description of the data

GetProportionMissingPerDataPointOK

protected double GetProportionMissingPerDataPointOK()
Description copied from class: AbstractDataProcessor
This method supports custom specification of how much sparsity is allowed per data point. If a given data point is missing more data than the specified proportion (0.00 - 1.00) across all instances, it will be filtered out and not used in machine-learning analysis steps.

Overrides:
GetProportionMissingPerDataPointOK in class AbstractDataProcessor
Returns:
Proportion of missing values allowed for a given data point

GetProportionMissingPerInstanceOK

protected double GetProportionMissingPerInstanceOK()
Description copied from class: AbstractDataProcessor
This method supports custom specification of how much sparsity is allowed per data instance. If a given data instance is missing more data than the specified proportion (0.00 - 1.00), it will be filtered out and not used in machine-learning analysis steps.

Overrides:
GetProportionMissingPerInstanceOK in class AbstractDataProcessor
Returns:
Proportion of missing values allowed for a given data instance

ParseRawData

protected void ParseRawData()
                     throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from class: AbstractDataProcessor
When this method is executed, raw data is parsed from the raw data directory and saved so it can be processed further. Classes that inherit from this class must implement this method if new data are being added to ML-Flex.

Overrides:
ParseRawData in class AbstractDataProcessor
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

                                         java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> fileLines)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
Checks to make sure a delimited file has a valid structure before it is parsed.

Parameters:
filePath - Absolute path to file
fileLines - Values in each file line
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
